meanings.definition: A mistaken perception or interpretation of something.
meanings.sent1: Her misperception of the situation led to confusion.
meanings.sent2: The misperception of his intentions caused unnecessary worry.
meanings.sent3: The misperception about the party theme made for a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His misperception of reality was like seeing a mirage in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The misperception painted a false picture in her mind.

meanings.definition: The act of perceiving something incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The misperception of the colors made the painting look strange.
meanings.sent2: His misperception of time made him late for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The misperception of the dog's size made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her misperception of distance was like trying to touch a rainbow.
meanings.sent5: The misperception distorted his view of reality.
